hypothesis_content.title: BTC 24H RSI Extreme Reversion in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and its 24-hour RSI crosses below 30 or above 70, a mean reversion move of at least 3% back towards the 50 level will occur within the next 48 hours, with the highest probability of success when volume is below its 20-day average.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes are characterized by range-bound price action and lack of strong directional momentum. Extreme RSI readings in low-volume environments are often driven by short-term sentiment or liquidity gaps, not fundamental shifts, creating high-probability reversion setups. The volume filter helps avoid catching 'breakdown/breakout' moves that can occur on high volume.
entry_conditions: Enter on close of candle confirming RSI extreme

exit_conditions.take_profit: 3% price move from entry in reversion direction
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 2% adverse move beyond entry (beyond the extreme)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If, in a NEUTRAL regime, more than 40% of trades triggered by these conditions hit their 2% stop loss before achieving a 3% profit target within 48 hours, the hypothesis is falsified.
